Photo by Ales Krivec on Unsplash

Frequently Asked Questions

We have three mutual funds: the Green Century Balanced Fund, the Green Century Equity Fund, and the Green Century MSCI International Index Fund.

There are four main differences between the Funds:

  1. Types of holdings. The Equity Fund and the International Index Fund invest in stocks. The Balanced Fund invests in stocks AND bonds.
  2. Geographic scope. The Equity Fund invests only in U.S. companies and the Balanced Fund predominantly invests in U.S. companies. The International Index Fund invests in companies outside of the U.S.
  3. Style of investment. The International Index Fund and the Equity Fund are passively managed funds, also known as index funds. They both invest in the stocks of companies included in indexes produced by MSCI that are customized for Green Century. ° The Balanced Fund is an actively managed fund; Trillium Asset Management is its subadvisor, or day-to-day portfolio manager, with the supervision of Green Century.
  4. Currently, all of the Funds have Individual Investor Share Classes with slightly different expense ratios (1.20% for the Equity Fund, 1.28% for the International Index Fund and 1.47% for the Balanced Fund). And the International Index Fund, the Equity Fund, and the Balanced Fund also have Institutional Share Classes with an expense ratio of 0.98%, 0.90%, and 1.17%, respectively. There is a $250,000/Fund investment minimum for the Institutional Share Classes.Please see the Green Century Funds page to learn more.
  • The inception date for the Balanced Fund is 3/18/1992.
  • The Equity Fund is invested in an index that commenced on 6/3/1991.
  • The International Fund is our newest fund, and it began operations on 9/30/2016.
  • GCINX for the Individual Share Class of the International Index Fund.
  • GCIFX for the Institutional Share Class of the International Index Fund.
  • GCEQX for the Individual Share Class of the Equity Fund.
  • GCEUX for the Institutional Share Class of the Equity Fund.
  • GCBLX for the Individual Share Class of the Balanced Fund.
  • GCBUX for the Institutional Share Class of the Balanced Fund.
  • Many news and financial websites report daily share prices using the Funds’ ticker symbols.

You can open a regular investment account with any of the Green Century Funds with a $2,500 per Fund minimum initial investment.

Individual Retirement Accounts (IRAs), Uniform Gift/Transfer to Minors Accounts (UGMA/UTMA), and Education Savings Accounts may be opened with a $1,000 per Fund minimum initial investment.

A minimum initial investment of only $1,000 per Fund is required for investors who wish to open a regular investment account with an Automatic Investment Plan of $100 or more per month.

There is a $250,000 per Fund minimum initial investment for the Institutional Share Class of the International Index Fund, the Institutional Share Class of the Equity Fund, and the Institutional Share Class of the Balanced Fund.

Yes. You can open an IRA in each of our three Fund’s Individual Investor Share Class by making a $1,000/Fund initial investment, by transferring an existing IRA account from another institution, or by consolidating several existing IRA accounts into one Green Century IRA account. The Funds offer Traditional, Roth, and SEP IRAs. The minimum initial investment for an IRA in the International Index Fund Institutional Share Class, the Equity Fund Institutional Share Class, and the Balanced Fund Institutional Share Class is $250,000/Fund.

The easiest way to transfer an IRA/retirement account is to use our IRA Transfer Request Form (PDF). Complete this form and mail it to us along with your IRA Account Registration Form (PDF). We will contact your current IRA custodian to have the funds transferred from your current IRA custodian to a Green Century IRA account. You should check with your current IRA custodian to determine if it requires a Medallion Signature Guarantee on the IRA Transfer Request Form.

Yes. Education Savings Accounts and Uniform Gift/Transfer to Minors Accounts (UGMA/UTMA) may be opened with a $1,000/Fund minimum initial investment. UGMA/UTMA accounts can be opened online. You can find forms and documents to open an Education Savings Account here.

All of the Green Century Funds are no-load, meaning there is no fee to buy or sell shares. Each Fund and share class has its own expense ratio (Balanced Fund Individual: 1.47%, Balanced Fund Institutional: 1.17%, Equity Fund Individual: 1.2%, Equity Fund Institutional: 0.9%, International Fund Individual: 1.28%, International Fund Institutional: 0.98%). For IRA/ESA accounts, there is a $15 annual custodial fee.

There are no sales charges, either as front- or back-end loads, associated with any share class. However, if you redeem your shares within 60 days of purchase or acquisition through exchange, you will be charged a redemption fee equal to 2.00% of the net asset value of the shares redeemed.

Please see a current prospectus for more information.

Obtain a prospectus and account registration form by downloading them here, or email your request to us at info@greencentury.com for information to be sent through the U.S. Mail. After reviewing the material, fill out the account registration form and mail it with your initial investment. You may also open an account online.

Where do I send my investment?

Send your investment and any necessary forms to:
Green Century Funds
P.O. Box 588
Portland, ME 04112

The overnight delivery address is:
Green Century Funds
Attn: Transfer Agent, Apex Fund Services
190 Middle Street, Suite 101
Portland, ME 04101

Many financial advisors use our Funds, which are widely available on many platforms including Charles Schwab and Fidelity. If your financial advisor cannot access the Green Century Funds, he or she can contact us to request a selling agreement.

Erin Gray, Vice President, Business Development
(206) 315-2998
egray@greencentury.com

Ms. Gray is a registered representative of UMB Distribution Services, LLC who can discuss investment options and strategies with your financial advisor.

Call 1-800-221-5519 between 8am and 6pm Eastern Time Monday through Friday to speak to a shareholder services representative about your account. Please have your account number ready for quicker service. You can also click here for current share price information.
In addition, you can now access your account information on this website – if you have not signed up already, you simply need to complete a brief registration process which requires you to provide your account number and your Social Security Number. You will have immediate online access to your Green Century Funds account(s). Click here to get started.

Income dividends, if any, are paid twice a year, typically in June and December. Capital gains, if any, are paid once a year, typically in December.

You may choose to have dividends and capital gains reinvested in your account or paid to you by check. Dividends and capital gains for retirement accounts must be reinvested rather than paid by check.

Click here to read more about our team.

No. The International Index Fund only invests in companies in approximately 20 developed markets outside of the U.S. You can view a list of the countries the International Index Fund invests in here.

Please email us at info@greencentury.com or call us toll-free at 1-800-934-7336 Monday to Friday to find out more information about our Funds.

Review a prospectus for more complete information on any of our Funds, including fees and expenses. Please read it carefully before you invest or send money.
